programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zachary Quinto goes scuba diving, spelunking and mountain climbing through the Mediterranean in search of the site of the fabled city of Atlantis.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An auction in Mesquite brings back bad memories for Ricky and Bubba, and Mary makes a strange discovery that leads her to a llama farm.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Things get hairy in Henderson when an impromptu brawl breaks out among some of the bidders.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, the manager cuts a deal that could increase profits.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley questions whether the pawn store has a thief in its midst when two teens come in with news of a scam.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers value renowned photographer Ansel Adams' lost work, and hope to acquire a Jaguar XJ6 and a ball signed by the 1946 Chicago Bears team.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Staff at the Las Vegas pawn shop get the chance to buy a 450-year-old book allegedly annotated by Isaac Newton, a Spanish-American War jacket and John Wayne memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers attend a locker auction in Orange County, where Ivy Calvin ends up having to dig through a pile of rubbish.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod realise they will have to pool their resources with Barry if they are to stand any chance of making a profit at an auction in San Jacinto.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Catalina, where they search for some auction treasure - but a shortage of units and time threatens their plans.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A trip to the hospital takes Allen out of the equation, so it is up to Tom and Big Sis to head to the auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: The floods that destroyed so much of New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina showed how fragile levee systems can be. Now, experts believe a worse flood could also strike Sacramento, and thousands of lives could be in danger..

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part two of two. Zachary Quinto continues his quest to prove that the city of Atlantis not only existed, but was a thriving empire.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley buys a 1950s Eljer toilet for $10, leading to Seth to purchase it for double the price in order that he can destroy it with a sledgehammer and storm out of the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth chooses to stay at home and calm down after his altercation with Ashley. However, the computer system goes down, so he has no choice but to come in and repair the system.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is excited when a clergyman sells him a rare baseball signed by Babe Ruth, complete with authentication papers - and knows it could be worth several thousand dollars.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch, which has no identifying markings other than the name on its face. The pressing question is how the company verify that it is genuine.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Chinatown, where a group of local thugs attempts to scupper the plucky duo's plans.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones run into an old friend and former employee at a particularly lively auction, and her new-found confidence seems set to lead to a confrontation.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After forging a signature blade from the steel rings of a whiskey barrel, the finalists create an instrument of Chinese warfare - the Qinglong Ji.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: Danny Trejo and the smiths forge two iconic weapons of modern Hollywood fantasy - the Oathkeeper and the Red Viper Spear - two legendary weapons from Game of Thrones. The team then puts the blades through and array of tests.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have some fun as they attempt to beat the competition, while Casey tries her hand at bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The PA Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: The bidders attend a series of auctions in the southern Californian city of Rancho Cucamonga.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, Guz Khan
programme.desc: Henning Wehn hosts from London's Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming Lucy Porter and Guz Khan to the stage.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Charles Dance, Stephen Mangan, Isy Suttie and Gok Wan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at the events of June 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, Guz Khan
programme.desc: Henning Wehn hosts from London's Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming Lucy Porter and Guz Khan to the stage.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedy panel game in which host Sue Perkins asks two teams to decide who is the greatest of the many people who share a particular name. In the first edition, captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe are joined by comedians Rob Beckett and Roisin Conaty, actor Stephen Mangan and historian Kate Williams to answer questions, while anecdotes abound and irreverent points are made, as the panellists jump between highbrow and popular culture.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are in seventh heaven when Cheap Trick guitarist Rick Nielsen opens the doors to his private rock 'n' roll warehouse.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Essex battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit an aviation museum that is closing down and are given their pick of the stock before looking for treasure in an art gallery's outbuildings and a barn.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find all manner of vintage items in a shop that has been closed for 60 years, and discover a scrap metal fortress.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Rival teams of amateur racers pit their wacky, gravity-powered soapbox vehicles in a downhill race against the clock in Paris.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters find three small cars at an affordable price - a task that involves pestering bankers, harnessing large dogs and almost getting arrested. James May meets American rally driver Ken Block, and Jeremy Clarkson tests out the Mercedes SL Black. Comedian Michael McIntyre is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Beer Silo, Plane Bar, Steam Train
programme.desc: A 32-metre long beer tank must navigate tiny roads to be installed at a brewery in Tadcaster, while in Kidderminster, a vintage steam train travels hundreds of miles south to Devon.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work taking place in one of Britain's leading police car workshops, as bespoke vehicles are built and repairs made to ones that have been out in the field. In the first episode, John Heussi finds himself in need of a new riot van, and stress-testing the old one helps him design a new one.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May test the Porsche Panamera against the Royal Mail's delivery service, racing a first-class letter to see which travels faster over the full length of the British Isles. Jeremy Clarkson gets chased by the British Army in some of their most deadly toys, and multi Olympic gold medal-winning sprinter Usain Bolt is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuiness, Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff go on a road trip in a trio of affordable second-hand convertibles. On the test track, Chris puts the new Ariel Atom through its paces, while Freddie goes bungee jumping off a dam in an old Rover.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including handing an item of clothing to a cyclist.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Dara O Briain, Denise Van Outen, Rhod Gilbert and Vernon Kay, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Charles Dance, Stephen Mangan, Isy Suttie and Gok Wan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedy panel game in which host Sue Perkins asks two teams to decide who is the greatest of the many people who share a particular name. In the first edition, captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe are joined by comedians Rob Beckett and Roisin Conaty, actor Stephen Mangan and historian Kate Williams to answer questions, while anecdotes abound and irreverent points are made, as the panellists jump between highbrow and popular culture.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: David Mitchell, Noel Fielding and Holly Walsh join Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme of 'night' in an extended edition of the panel show. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Maisie Adam, Sara Barron and Rob Beckett are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry discover which of them is this series' winner.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: The team acquire a personalised Victorian pistol and try to track down the original owner. A customer brings in brasses that his dad brought back from the Somme.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The mysterious death of the Duke of Kent in a 1942 plane crash, which has led to accusations of the Royal family erasing him from history.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines animals that are able to expand their bodies, including anacondas and camels.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingoes and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species' behaviour in similar ways.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New York's skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Lieutenant General Leslie Morshead, who commanded the British and Australian troops who held off Rommel's Afrika Korps at the port of Tobruk in 1941.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to buy a new suit until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel persuades him to. He agrees, but only if I can be made in the same style as his old one. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright expands his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by a close encounter with some perishables.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Two long-dead bodies are found in a disused coal mine on the outskirts of Glasgow when it is reopened to serve as the central attraction for a museum. Investigations reveal the pair had been involved in violent encounters just before their deaths, and the search to discover their identities uncovers deeply buried resentments in the community. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton, Blythe Duff and John Michie.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Pat is forced to deal with a persistent complainer who has been hounding the station, and becomes concerned when he starts stalking her. Eventually Pat is abducted by Warrington and forced to discover Cassie North's corpse. Drama, starring Kate Buffery and Richard E Grant.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the inspirational Bluebell Cottage in Cheshire, which is open to the public as part of the National Gardens Scheme project.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah performs a spiritual cleansing in the local creek as a religious occasion approaches, but she's spotted by Doris Collins. She finds it hard to deal with the woman's reaction to her nudity, but it is her own personal demons that she is struggling with the most. Marta Dusseldorp and Deborah Kennedy star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Anna and Gino's romance continues to blossom as they sneak off to spend time together - even though it's clear that something about their secret trysts is playing on Gino's mind. Meanwhile, at Ash Park, Olivia and James's relationship is at breaking point as Olivia struggles with the identity of James's lover. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry appears in court to testify against brother Ben, but reacts badly to being questioned about his own childhood abuse, indirectly jeopardising the outcome of the trial. Phil begins to realise he is powerless to stop former lover Christine emigrating with their daughter Madison, while Smithy spends the night with sultry Louise Larson, unaware Zain Nadir is investigating the criminal activities of her husband Pete.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie is devastated when her patient collapses and there is not enough time to arrange a heart transplant. Nick tries to get Diane on his side by letting her perform a difficult procedure for the first time, while Ric talks her into taking the research position full time. Kyla brings Max to work as he is a diabetic and she is worried about his blood sugar levels.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The atmosphere is tense between new nurse Barney Wolfe and Adam as they fail to see eye to eye. Two serious cases of food poisoning panic one unfortunate fellow, who rushes home to check on his son, only to discover that his wife is having an affair, and Duffy begins to feel the pressures of her new responsibilities. Derek Thompson, Cathy Shipton and Ian Bleasdale star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Anita Dobson guests as Phil Hunter's mum Lynne, who turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Smithy seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Adam struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. In court, the case against Terry's brother Ben concludes - but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelley's ready to be more than friends with Mark. Pauline's determined to find out about Pete's disappearance. Gita warns Cindy about Richard.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard continues to pursue Cindy, meanwhile Pauline has concerns about Arthur.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A man climbs a chimney in protest against the Thames Relief Road, but the rescue escalates into a serious operation.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie begins coaching the Glenbogle five-a-side team for their big match against Glencampbell, but reluctantly hands over the reins to his brother Paul to allow him to concentrate on important estate business. Molly attempts to avoid a weekend trip with Andrew, fearing she is not ready for a new romance, and Golly is reunited with his estranged daughter Jess.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The nurses get more than they bargained for as they prepare for a darts match in the Skelthwaite Arms, and Beth has a surprise visitor. Drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell family try to cope without Nellie, who has some surprise visitors - her 'fancy man' Derek and Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: It is a day of discontent at Maplin's when the pay packets arrive, and Ted and Spike act out the French Revolution in the swimming pool. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel settle down to enjoy a quiet evening, only to find themselves constantly disturbed by ominous noises from the empty house next door. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo gets out his old motorbike and tries to perform a few stunts - much to the surprise of Blamire and Clegg. Bill Owen, Michael Bates and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective duo are called to a hospital, where a series of suspicious deaths has raised fears a serial killer may be at work on the wards. A grisly collection of body parts is found in a nearby lake, and both patients and staff are dropping dead with alarming regularity. However, Pascoe soon finds his own health is as much of a worry as the case itself. Robert Powell, Miriam Karlin and Haydn Gwynne guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Fresh DNA tests on an unidentified body found in 1996 reveal a family link to a Home Office fingerprint analyst, who has not seen her brother since she was seven, when he brought her over to the UK from their home country of Albania. The victim had been working as a police interpreter - and the motive seems clear when it turns out his last assignment was translating for a witness in a murder trial against a notorious Albanian criminal. Meanwhile, Gerry embarks on a French cookery course, but the language barrier results in a rather surprising date. Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Eve links DNA evidence found at a traffic collision to a murder case she worked on while examining mass graves during the Balkan War, leaving Boyd determined to track down the perpetrators, a ring of war criminals now living and working in the UK. Starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with guest stars Ron Cook, Anna Madeley and Branka Katic.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a man accidentally throwing a hammer through his patio door, a young couple interrupted during a romantic proposal and a woman in labour who decides to play a prank on her midwife.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Andrea McLean, Coleen Nolan, Judi Love and Jane Moore are joined by Coronation Street star Shelley King to discuss the abuse storyline of her character Yasmeen Nazir.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Brian Turner to explore the culinary delights of his native Yorkshire, with James visiting Frances Atkins' restaurant The Yorke Arms, where he enjoys her signature dish al fresco in her unusual dining room the Onion. Brian tastes the delights of some local charcuterie and is challenged to some off-road driving, while James brushes up his clay-pigeon shooting skills.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five colleagues answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chris, Jane, Shanice and Bernard pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: On her first day of chemotherapy, Vanessa urges Charity to stay home and look after a sick Moses, but Kerry's appearance at the hospital makes Charity see red. Harriet and Will suggest to Dawn that she asks the social worker for advice on the issues she's been having with Lucas, while Mandy reveals more of her history with Paul to Lydia.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha's horrified when Dev forces her to attend Mary's youth volunteering group tidying up Victoria Gardens and feels the eyes of the world on her. Ken acquires proof that Charles deposited all payments from the Stillwaters residents into his personal bank account, while Carla agrees to take charge at the Rovers.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The team are in Hackney, where they surprise Jeroume and Onessa Cariazo, the parents of wheelchair-bound nine-year-old Elijah, who has rare genetic condition myotubular myopathy. Alan Titchmarsh, Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney give Elijah the sensory stimulation he craves, transforming the family's uneven overgrown urban courtyard into an accessible paradise complete with tropical water feature, a sensory beach and Asian-style dining zone.

programme.title: A Mother's Son
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama, starring Hermione Norris, Martin Clunes, Paul McGann and Alexander Arnold. The murder of a schoolgirl rocks the residents of a quiet coastal town in Suffolk, and when Rosie stumbles upon a pair of bloodstained trainers hidden in her home, she suspects someone in her family may have been involved in the killing. With her son Jamie and stepson Rob both acting suspiciously, could she be right?.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Summer of Love (San Francisco and Napa Valley)
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix head to San Francisco, the free-spirited capital of the United States. They start out by sampling the latest trends of using cannabis in cooking, which was legalised in California in 2018 - but as they enjoy a hippy afternoon tea, Gino overindulges and chaos ensues, especially when the next activity on the agenda is a session of goat yoga. Moving on, the trio dig for clams on the Pacific coast, take a hot-air ride to a vineyard and visit a factory in Chinatown where fortune cookies are made. It seems a competition is in order and so the travel companions see who can make the most cookies in 60 seconds.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell focuses on a multi-million-dollar wreck tied to Sir Francis Drake. He and his team race to locate a treacherous area identified on the map as Dragon's Teeth.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Facing bankruptcy, Alaskan gold miner Farley Dean treks to Bougainville Island, Papua New Guinea, to seek a fortune apparently guarded by giant, man-eating crocodiles.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Desperate signs from lost veterans in Vietnam are captured by satellite, and a fleet of massive ships is stranded in the middle of a desert.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr begins fabricating his first bike, but over at Orange County Choppers, Paul Sr's team is building a ramp to launch a dummy of his son over a creek.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.sub-title: Two If By Air, One If By Sea
programme.desc: The debtor comes after Ken and Danny full-force when they seize a luxury yacht, while Kevin and Heather face a mid-air nightmare.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe makes food for the fish in an aquarium at the Mandalay Bay casino in Las Vegas, before learning how the USA's population of sea lampreys is controlled.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how channel signs are created, wetsuits are manufactured and aluminium aircrafts are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Rubber Gloves/Soap Carvings/Aircraft Cabinets/Motorcycle Brake Locks
programme.desc: The manufacture of objects such as rubber gloves and aircraft cabinets, and how processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How manufacturer Lea and Perrins concocts its famous Worcestershire sauce. Plus, the shredding of cars and the making of sarees.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to Somerset to hunt down a 1970s VW Type 3 Fastback. They also revamp a Rover P6 built at the height of the British Leyland crisis.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: There is a crisis on board the Cornelia Marie as the skipper becomes ill, while on the Northwestern Jake Anderson uncovers disturbing details about his father's disappearance.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: All the teams are working hard to make the season pay, but have to contend with the weight of the past before they can land on future riches.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is pleased to buy a V8-engined BMW 840 coupe - but when mechanic Edd China sees the condition it is in, he struggles to muster the same enthusiasm.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini investigates a lead on a 1956 Citroen 2CV in North Carolina, as he suspects it could be one of the first of its kind to be imported into the US.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini recommisions his 1934 Lincoln KB convertible for the Keels & Wheels concours in Texas.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 727 2cam Ferrari owned by the heirs of the Parker Pen is inspected in Maryland, along with a Thunderbird convertible.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini purchases a 1941 Ford Woody, with only 15,000 miles on the clock.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and motorcycle restorer Sam Lovegrove head to Herefordshire, where they discover sheds full of engines, autogyros and weird and wonderful vehicles of all kinds, before coming away with a British classic.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove drive on to Gloucestershire to uncover some oily treasure. They find a picturesque farm where deer, goats and pigs rub shoulders with vintage agricultural equipment. But can they make a quick return on today's find?.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: A Russian client seeks artefacts from the fall of Berlin. Bruce Crompton sees an opportunity to offload a German 88mm anti-tank weapon that was used in the battle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finally opens his own antiques shop in his home town of Conwy, so goes to the Cotswolds and one of the UK's largest indoor antiques, looking for treasure.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Cabinet-maker Alex resurrects a once-stunning 300-year-old chest that's only fit for firewood. Plus, taxidermist Chris is challenged to resuscitate a Victorian heron.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a Toyota MR2 in need of Edd China's expertise, and the mechanic soon gets to work overhauling the car's bodywork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues working on the Toyota MR2, while Mike Brewer heads to a specialist company to get some refurbished wheels.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 19th-century Bradford weaving mill, where he discovers industrial trolleys and containers. In Cheshire, he visits a manor house mentioned in the Domesday book.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hopes to find some unwanted treasures as he travels to a steam museum in Norfolk. In Hereford, he is given privileged access to a collection.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats face an unexploded bomb and deadly gasses. The Bros attempt to rescue their season, and rookie team The Poms go underground for the first time.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Captain Jake Anderson has a shot at redemption after deliberately defying Sig, and the fleet battles against mental and physical breakdown late into the Opilio season.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Blast Through Rock/Map Earth/Provide Flowers Year-Round
programme.desc: The technology used to blast through 10,000 tons of rock, map Earth from space and provide fresh flowers all year round.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological innovations and production methods that allow people to work in extreme heat and put the fizz in champagne.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor encounters a girl who claims contaminated well-water killed her father. Plus, a man dies after complaining of severely aching knees - did he overdose on pain relief - or was he ill?.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened when a 43-year-old man took a nap at his parents' house, and was later found dead in bed. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her sofa.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The medic considers the case of a 42-year-old waiter who collapsed and died while leaving the restaurant where he worked. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her bathroom floor.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A young man becomes violently ill and dies soon after eating a fish sandwich, leaving the medic to determine whether it was the result of a rare and lethal form of food poisoning or an unlikely killer. Plus, a woman is killed in a car accident with a drunk driver and the autopsy reveals several devastating clues that she may have played a key role in her own tragic death.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The bloodiest gun battle in the FBI's history, which occurred on April 11, 1986, when agents attempted to apprehend two suspects responsible for a prolonged crime spree.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Stephen Goldman checks on a breeder's kennels, only to discover 100 American bulldogs living in unhealthy conditions.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown visits the USA, where he meets a woman with the largest collection of pet cats he has ever seen and an eccentric skateboarding dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jesyca wants a flattering dress, Duvae is looking for something sophisticated and Sara returns for her fitting, following her surprise proposal at Kleinfeld's.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride's friend hates every dress she sees, while another walks off the run way and refuses to be in the wedding wearing a strapless dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her mother-in-law about the length of dresses, and another gets into a dispute with her opinionated wedding planner.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Hard-to-please bride Rene brings along her even pickier mother, while Nnenna's mum grows tired of her daughter's indecision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Margaret talks about missing her deceased mother as she shops for a wedding dress, while Emily feels lucky to have her mum's support.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Caitlyn has no intention of sharing the spotlight while shopping for a dress, while Mojdeh is convinced her consultant will not be able to help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop, while another customer seeks to combine the styles of Audrey Hepburn and Joan Jett.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Rescue dog Benji's heart problem concerns Dr Chris, and Smudge the cat's injuries shock Lisa, who hopes surgeons can reconstruct the animal's leg. Tim helps out some alligators.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Coffs Harbour where he visits Dolphin Marine Magic, and explores one of the greatest friendships between man and animal.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: When arrested for historic sexual offences, TV weatherman Fred Talbot tried to hide the truth in police interviews. However, his repeated response of 'no comment' spoke volumes.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: When April Barber was murdered at a remote Florida beauty spot, her husband Justin said he tried to stop the killer and even appealed for help on television. Experts analyse the deception in his words and deeds of August 2002.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: A case from May 1997, when eight-year-old Jamie Lavis was on the Manchester bus Darren Vickers was driving just prior to his disappeance. Vickers joined the hunt and spoke on television - but was hiding an awful truth. Bones from Jamie's torso were eventually found hidden in bushes on a golf course five months later, and evidence led detectives back to the driver.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Shana Grice was murdered after being stalked by her ex-boyfriend, Michael Lane. He denied involvement, but experts examined police videos to determine the truth.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Holly already has a failed weight-loss surgery, so to succeed she must alter more than her eating habits. However, she must also overcome the childhood trauma that still haunts her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of 30-year-old Joe, who must find the strength to face his past after losing his job and ending up mostly housebound.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three bargain hunters head to Montpellier in southern France in search of items to upcycle. Siobhan identifies a retro tapestry that could be a money-spinner, Raj creates a personalised table top by printing a photograph onto MDF, and Lyn overhauls a 100-year-old cot. The items are later put up for auction in Shoreditch, London.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James shocks the team by offering free valuations for charity in this festive special. Model and entrepreneur Caprice sells a designer dress for a worthy cause, while a French mother is stunned when she learns more about a diamond-encrusted necklace she wants to sell to raise 20,000 for Christmas. Lawrence gets excited when a grandfather turns up with a signed Manny Pacquiao boxing glove, and the staff get ready for the office party with a surprise visit from a Secret Santa.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After marital problems and life as a single parent, Melissa struggles with weight gain during a stressful period.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The family is shocked by Meri's recent bombshell, and the wives have to deal with the repercussions.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of Levi Bellfield, who denied his connection to a series of murders and rapes. However, videotaped police interviews told a different story.
